SIZE CUTOFF FOR EVALUATION
low risk patients
with lesions <1 cm [<0.4 in.] on U/S do not require
FNA, but need to be followed over time with a repeat
U/S in 6 12 months. Nodules of 1.5 cm [0.6 in.] or
more should be biopsied
THYROID FUNCTION AND CANCER RISK
thyroid
nodules have a 5% risk of being malignant; 1/3 of all
nodules are cold and less than 1/3 of cold nodules are
malignant. Functioning nodules are usually benign.
Follicular lesions have an increased risk of malignancy
of 20% and should be removed by thyroidectomy.
Cold nodules in the setting of Graves’ disease also
have a higher risk of malignancy
